result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI 6th and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI 6th and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kenneth Melvin Wulff was found guilty of OWI 6th, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pursuant to Plea Hearing on 09/01/2016, credit if revoked is to be determined.  Refusal, 13TR6537, reopened and found proper.  Chippewa County cases 14FO19 and 15CF379 dismissed and read-in.
With credit for any administrative suspension.

Ignition Interlock Device shall be installed prior to operating a motor vehicle.  The length of Ignition Interlock Device will begin when a valid driver's license or occupational license has been issued.  (Call Dept of Motor Vehicles with questions).

miscConds.notes:
Plus supervision fees.   
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
$200 represents DNA surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

Not to possess or consume any alcohol. 
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  
Not to possess or consume any controlled substance not prescribed by authorized medical personnel.  
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Not to drive w/o a valid driver's license.  
Not to drive with any alcohol in system.

timeConds.notes:
Electronic Monitoring authorized if qualifies.
Pursuant to Court Order on 10/05/2016, 2 days credit on conditional 12 month Jail imposed.
Consecutive to: any other sentence currently serving
